item.title: False diplomas, how to avoid them?
item.description:
False diplomas are a more common phenomenon than you might think, and can degrade the quality of your recruitments. How common is it? What are the risks for the employer and the candidate? How do you deal with it? Here is everything you need to know.

Fake diplomas: a common phenomenon?

In our audits, we find that one in 8 resumes contains a serious lie. And many of them involve fake diplomas.

item.title: GDPR and respect of personnal data
item.description:
Thanks to a simple, efficient platform, you can manage all aspects of your audits: track the progress of the process, access detailed audit trails and consult summary reports on individual candidates.

No verification begins without the clear and explicit consent of the data owner. The data collected and used, the purposes for which it is processed, and the processing itself are all explained upstream.

A transparent process

Applicants can exercise their right to have their personal data deleted or withdraw their consent at any time. At the end of the agreed retention period, the personal data held by EveryCheck is anonymized.

item.title: Three options to secure your hires
item.description:
Our hiring security solution is based on a factual check of CV information, and can be enhanced with two other options: reference checks with former managers and security checks up to criminal records.

The basic solution: verification of diploma and experience

With the verification of the CV of your future employees, you secure your hiring by checking the authenticity of the diplomas and experiences presented to the recruiter.
